instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Starts only on safe mode.
threads.message: I have Macbook Pro 15 Late 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B. This one dosen't start normally. Only when i take the charger off and hold the button and then put the charger. Fans run full of course because its safe mode. Anyways in safe mode everything works great. Battery is missing from this macbook and the wifi connector is bad. I will fix it after i have found with your help why it doesn't start normally.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Starts only on safe mode.
threads.message: Got green light? Are you using a known 85W charger? Is 12.6V present at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Starts only on safe mode.
threads.message: This sounds like an SMC bypass, and in doing so, also loosing wifi, fan control, ect. Check if you're getting <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, and when you in the OS, go to the system info and see if your computer can see what SMC firmware your running
